articles.title: Highfield AI, multimodal agentic AI solution for broadcast graphics workflow, unveiled at NAB Show
articles.author: Contributed Content
articles.summary: HighField AI will unveil at the 2025 NAB Show (N259) the industry's first multimodal agentic AI solution designed to improve professional broadcast graphics workflow efficiency by up to 75%. HighField AI was created by industry leaders Amir Hochfeld, Ofir Benovici, Piotr Koszur, and David Dowling.

articles.title: When Google Assistant is phased out, what happens to our smart speakers?
articles.author: Jon Gilbert
articles.summary: By the end of 2025, Google Assistant will no longer be available on mobile devices. Google Assistant is the default voice assistant on all of Google's Home and Nest devices and many third-party manufacturers' smart home products. Google is bringing a new experience, powered by Gemini, to home devices like speakers, displays and TVs.

articles.title: KosAbility: Using "AI" for research yields wrong answers. Often.
articles.author: wilderness voice
articles.summary: Gemini AI gave a false answer to the question "Cinnamaldehyde in Ceylon cinnamon inhibits amino acid decarboxylase activity in oral bacteria" in the comments on a forum post. The poster didn't check the reference provided by AI. AI boosters try to tout the benefits of AI.

articles.title: Baichuan's Big Pivot
articles.author: Ella Apostoaie
articles.summary: Two of Baichuan AI start-up's co-founders resigned last week to start their own business. It comes months after another top executive left the multibillion dollar company. The company's "leading edge is even more pronounced in Omni-1.5".

articles.title: I let Gemini turn complex research into podcasts. I'll never go back
articles.author: Digital Trends
articles.summary: Google's Gemini AI can now turn boring documents into an interesting document.    Google‚Äôs Gemini AI is able to do this with its AI-powered machine learning system, called Gemini AI, which is developed by Google's Project Glimmer.

articles.title: 10 jobs in photography that AI is coming for ‚Äì and the 10 that are safest
articles.author: Tom May
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is revolutionizing the creative profession. Some photography jobs are being automated at breakneck speed, such as corporate headshots, product photography and event photography. Ariane Sherine explains which jobs are most vulnerable to AI and which ones are most likely to survive.

articles.title: How is the tech industry thinking about AI's environmental impact?
articles.summary: Local NPR for the Cape, Coast & Islands is 90.1 91.1 94.3. CRB Classical is playing. We investigate how the tech industry is thinking about its environmental footprint as it invests in energy-consuming new AI models and 2025 NPR Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

articles.title: Perplexity CEO denies having financial issues, says no IPO before 2028
articles.author: Anthony Ha
articles.summary: Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas responded to a Reddit user's complaint about the company's financial situation. He said the company has all the funding it has raised and its revenue is only growing. Perplexity has no plans of IPOing before 2028.

articles.title: East Texas data expert discusses Texas bill to criminalize making deep fake election videos
articles.author: Michael Richardson
articles.summary: Michael Richardson speaks with East Texas data evidence expert Tim McLemee about HB 2795 and artificial intelligence in Texas. He asks him about his thoughts on it and his opinion on it to KLTV's Michael Richardson and Tim McLamee on the topic.

articles.title: Teachers warn AI is impacting students' critical thinking
articles.author: Ivana Saric
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is playing an increasingly dominant role in how students navigate school. Gina Parnaby, a 12th-grade English teacher at Atlanta's Marist school, believes AI can hurt students' critical thinking skills. Alexa Borota, a high school teacher in Trenton, New Jersey, thinks AI is corrosive on younger students who don't have the foundations of knowledge that college and graduate students do. Denise Pope, a senior lecturer at Stanford's School of Education, thinks teachers should rethink assignments to ensure students are still using critical thinking.

articles.title: Are Amazon's New AI Chatbots Worth Using?
articles.author: New York Magazine
articles.summary: Amazon has about 1,000 different generative AI applications it's either built or is in the process of building right now. Amazon wants the world and its investors to know it's trying a few new things with AI and it's working on new ideas.

articles.title: How Central Florida health care providers are balancing innovation
articles.author: WFTV Staff
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) tools are changing the way health care workers help patients. AI can enhance diagnostics, treatment and administrative efficiency. However, there's a need for human oversight, validation and governance to ensure the safety and data security of the people they serve.

articles.title: How Central Florida health care providers are balancing innovation

articles.title: Woman Alarmed When Date Uses ChatGPT to Psychologically Profile Her
articles.author: Noor Al-Sibai
articles.summary: A date used ChatGPT's new "deep research" tool to create a psychological profile on Jemima Kelly for his date. Kelly is a reporter who has written many articles for the chatbot. She asked both ChatGpt and Google Gemini to profile her for her own edification.

articles.title: Google Expands AI Mode Access to Free Users on Waitlist
articles.author: Hilary Ong
articles.summary: Google's AI Mode feature is now available to free users who had previously applied and joined the waitlist. This move expands access to the AI-powered search experience, which was previously exclusive to Google One AI Premium subscribers. The rollout marks a significant move toward democratizing access to generative AI tools.

articles.title: OpenAI's Sora Has a Small Problem With Being Hugely Racist and Sexist
articles.summary: OpenAI's AI tool, Sora, perpetuated racist, sexist, and ableist stereotypes in its video-generating AI models, according to Wired. Expert warn that the biased depictions in AI videos will amplify the stereotyping of marginalized groups. OpenAI has safety teams dedicated to researching and reducing bias, and other risks.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence ‚Äòcan help single people find love'
articles.summary: Justin McLeod founded the Hinge dating app in 2012. He says AI is helping users write profiles and choose photos which are more likely to be successful. Hinge is the second most popular app in the UK with more than 1.4 million users recorded in May 2024, according to Ofcom.

articles.title: AppLovin (APP) Set to Dominate Mobile Marketing with AI-Powered Audience+ Platform

However, the company is not expecting its cash flow to turn positive until 2029.

articles.title: Spectral AI Inc. (MDAI) Poised for FDA Approval with Revolutionary DeepView System
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Spectral AI Inc. (NASDAQ:MDAI) is an artificial intelligence company focusing on medical diagnostics, predictive analytics, and healing predictions. The company expects revenue to triple to $12.7 billion in 2025, but it is struggling with significant costs from chips, data centers, and talent needed to develop cutting-edge AI systems. It is not expecting its cash flow to turn positive until 2029. MDAI ranks 10th on our list of AI stocks dominating the news this week.

articles.title: Agentic AI vs. GenAI: The shift towards autonomous systems
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: As the AI landscape evolves from Generative AI to Agentic AI, organizations are preparing for a shift that automates decision-making and streamlines processes. GenAI is responsible for creating content like text-based articles, images, videos, etc. AgenticAI takes it a step further by acting on behalf of humans to drive outcomes.

articles.title: Doctor explains how artificial intelligence is already being deployed in medical care
articles.author: Katia Hetter
articles.summary: According to a CNN survey, most Americans are uncomfortable with the idea of their doctors using artificial intelligence to manage their care. Dr. Leana Wen explains the different uses of AI in health care. She explains the difference between predictive and generative AI. She also explains how to protect your privacy.

articles.title: A Medical Blessing of Artificial Intelligence (AI)
articles.author: W. F. Twyman
articles.summary: Matt McDonagh's friend's life was saved twice by artificial intelligence. Robert Breedlove believes the AI trends are in one direction, until the trend ends. There is a temptation for apprehension over the next five years that AI will become obsolete like the horse harness maker of yesterday.

articles.title: Cloudflare Using Devilish Trick to Trap AI Scrapers in Infinite Maze of AI-Generated Content
articles.summary: Cloudflare is offering a service it calls an "AI labyrinth" to prevent third party AI crawlers from flooding the internet with AI-generated content. Cloudflare claims that it fields about 50 billion bot requests to its network daily, or about 1 percent of all internet traffic.

articles.title: Is your iPhone really hacked? Or is it those fake security alerts?
articles.author: Kurt Knutsson
articles.summary: Fake Apple virus warnings on iPhone are a scam to trick people into thinking their device has been hacked. Bonnie from El Paso, Texas, experienced two such pop-ups on her iPhone 8 Plus in the past couple of days. Here are some tips on how to avoid these scams and protect your device.

articles.summary: Ray Kurzweil predicts that by 2045 AI will be billions of times smarter than humans. The singularity involves merging with AI through brain-computer interfaces and 8.5 billion people forming a collective intelligence driving exponential growth. Traditional ways of living, like gardening and hiking, are still valuable.

articles.title: Ridings: What AI can't replace: Your local newspaper

articles.author: Roger Fingas
articles.summary: ChatGPT Pro is an AI chatbot that costs $200 per month. It's aimed at researchers and engineers trying to solve complicated math and science questions. People with the cash to pay for AI every month on top of other life expenses could gain an advantage over people scraping by.

articles.title: Are We At Peak AI Bubble And The Cusp Of ‚ÄòAI Moment'?
articles.author: Gil Press
articles.summary: CoreWeave, the first AI startup to go public, disappointed investors, ending its first day of trading with a market cap of $19 billion. In January, the 'DeepSeek Moment' pushed the AI bubble to the brink of a noisy blowout. The evolution of AI has been punctuated by peaks of inflated expectations and troughs of disillusionment.

articles.title: Eliot Sanborn: Dear ChatGPT: A writer's plea
articles.summary: ChatGPT is boring and stale. Eliot Sanborn wants ChatGPT to write a letter about how to be a good writer. He believes learning how to become a better writer makes you a better person, but he doesn't want to learn from someone who doesn't understand him or her.

articles.title: Watch eerie video of humanoid robot 'army' marching naturally, thanks to a major AI upgrade
articles.author: Ben Turner
articles.summary: A U.S. robotics company has used artificial intelligence to give its humanoid robots a more natural-looking stride. Figure's engineers used a learning technique called reinforcement learning to improve their walking through trial and error. The technology is key to the California company's plans to roll out its robots on factory floors in the future.

articles.title: Hardwired for God: Why faith isn't a roadblock to AI innovation
articles.author: Nora Kenney
articles.summary: Stanford study suggests AI is outperforming human doctors in diagnosing illnesses and making complex medical decisions. Ross Douthat's new book, 'Believe', argues that religious faith is intellectually superior to its alternatives. Some in Silicon Valley see AI as the next step in evolution, a force that will leave humanity behind. If God is real and humans are created for a purpose, that should change how we think about AI and a post-human future.

articles.title: Gemini 2.5 Pro is now free to all users in surprise move

articles.title: AI enables paralyzed man to control robotic arm with brain signals
articles.summary: Researchers at UC San Francisco have achieved a breakthrough in brain-computer interface (BCI) technology, enabling people with paralysis to control robotic devices through thought alone. BCIs have previously struggled to maintain functionality over extended periods, often losing effectiveness after just one or two days. The newly developed BCI has set a record by functioning seamlessly for seven months without major adjustments.

articles.title: Better Artificial Intelligence Stock: SoundHound AI vs. Cerence AI
articles.author: Jeremy Bowman
articles.summary: SoundHound AI has been one of the best-performing stocks since artificial intelligence (AI) became the hot phrase in the market around the end of 2022. SoundHound has a market cap of $4 billion but is still a small-cap company with plenty of room for future growth. Cerence is a bigger company with a $400 million market cap and focuses on AI-powered virtual assistants for the mobility and transportation market. The company counts nearly every major automobile OEM as its customer, including BMW, Daimler, Ford, Ford Motor Company, General Motors, and others.

articles.title: BBB Scam alert: New tech creates fake calls and voicemails
articles.author: Hansen
articles.summary: AI technology can be used to mimic the voice of people you may know. Scammers can make messages that appear to come from anywhere, like the boss's email account or a close family member. A voicemail is received from a superior at work. At home, a phone call or voicemail from a family member can be fake.

articles.author: John Herrman
articles.summary: Last month Amazon debuted Rufus, a chatbot alternative to search, and last week it started testing Interests, which turns descriptive requests into auto-updating widgets you can come back to and check. Google didn't end up replacing Search with a stripped-down, ad-free AI alternative. Google is struggling to resolve tensions between its advertising business and its own.

articles.author: Elizabeth Hlavinka
articles.summary: Viki, 30, is out of work and unable to afford traditional therapy, so she used an AI chatbot to help her process her feelings. One company, Wysa, was granted a special designation from the Food and Drug Administration for people with depression and anxiety related to chronic pain.

articles.title: The Five Things You Shouldn't Tell ChatGPT
articles.author: Nicole Nguyen
articles.summary: ChatGPT has learned a lot from OpenAI's ChatGPT over the past few years. The AI picked up factoids from their many conversations and banked them in its memory. It remembered I like eggs, I have a baby who nurses to sleep and I need to modify my exercise because of my achy back.

articles.title: Generative AI users in Korea nearly double in 2024
articles.author: Korea Times
articles.summary: The number of users of artificial intelligence services in Korea nearly doubled from a year earlier in 2024, according to government data. The illustration shows the ChatGPT logo, a keyboard, and robot hands, January 27, and the number of AI users in Korea.

articles.author: Tevi Troy
articles.summary: In his new book, Like Silicon from Clay, Michael Rosen takes a deep dive into AI and divides the AI commentariat into four categories: optimistic, fearful, optimistic and pessimistic. For this subject, Rosen uses Jewish tradition to describe two models: the golem and the dybbuk.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to users making Ghibli style images using ChatGPT: Let my team sleep please ...
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: ChatGPT's Ghibli-style photo generating capabilities have taken the internet by storm. OpenAI's CEO Sam Altman has a request for ChatGPT users: "Can yall please chill on generating images this is insane, our team needs sleep".

articles.summary: The recent introduction of OpenAI's image generation feature in ChatGPT has ignited a Studio Ghibli trend that's breaking the internet. OpenAI asks people to stop generating images in the style of the anime directors because their team needs to sleep.

articles.summary: As artificial intelligence (AI) becomes more widespread, fundamental transformations are occurring in processes and the skill sets of the workforce across all affected domains, says In. In. It is changing the way people work and the way they perceive the world around them.

Critics have raised concerns and questioned whether it is just a publicity stunt. Charlie Beckett, an expert on AI in journalism, said using AI to create editorial content is dangerous.

He also raises questions about the future of human creativity and over-reliance on AI tools.

articles.title: Bloomberg Faces Challenges with AI Summaries Rollout
articles.author: support101@QUE.com
articles.summary: Bloomberg is trying to integrate AI summaries into its news service offering. The implementation of the technology has not been smooth sailing. The successful rollout of AI could herald a new era in journalism, where technology supplements human insight to provide timely, accurate, and relevant financial information.

articles.title: Ridings: What AI can't replace: Your local newspaper
articles.author: Amy Gilligan
articles.summary: When misused, artificial intelligence can be dangerous. A recent Nieman Lab investigation uncovered a network of AI-generated newsletters published in more than 350 towns across 47 states. The newsletters repackage local news content without permission, without credit and without paying journalists who did the work.

There is a growing market of products that promise users an experience that approximates the impossible.

articles.title: The Future of Law: How Technology Is Changing the Way Law Firms Serve Clients
articles.author: Harvey J
articles.summary: Law firms are adopting technology to improve efficiency, improve client relationships, and remain competitive in a rapidly evolving market. AI-powered tools can draft contracts, conduct legal research, and predict case outcomes. E-discovery tools have transformed the process of information retrieval during litigation. Cybersecurity threats pose significant risks to law firms.

articles.title: Gutefrage.net Relevance in the Age of Chatbots
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: ChatGPT 4O is the latest version of OpenAI's AI-powered chat platform. It aims to provide expert-level answers with a level of accuracy and correctness comparable to, and perhaps exceeding, that of human specialists. It has important implications for various sectors, including healthcare, research, and public discourse.

articles.title: Bill Gates and the AI Delusion
articles.author: David Manney
articles.summary: Bill Gates has long been an advocate for the transformative power of artificial intelligence. He has funded A.I. research, backed startups to revolutionize health care and education, and published blog posts heralding a new era where machine learning improves efficiency, accuracy, and accessibility for billions. His latest proclamations signal how distant his world is from ours. He lives in a world of elite conferences, private jets, and investment portfolios. His access to information is instant and filtered through teams of experts. In that environment, it is easy to imagine machines replacing people. He believes that with enough innovation, we can solve everything but not every problem is an engineering challenge.

articles.title: Hello Mister Chips March 29, 2025 8:28 PM Subscribe
articles.author: Harvey Kilobit
articles.summary: Starting this fall, schools in Beijing must provide at least eight hours of AI instruction per academic year. Elementary schoolers would take hands-on courses to kick-start their understanding of AI. High school students would focus on AI applications and innovation. An engineering professor teaches his students how to program.

articles.title: 'Something is rotten': Apple's AI strategy faces doubts
articles.summary: Apple is having problems with its artificial intelligence (AI) technology. John Gruber, an Apple enthusiast, has criticized the company for not being more skeptical when it announced last June that its Siri chatbot would be getting a major AI upgrade. The technology was supposed to be released as part of the Apple Intelligence suite of iPhone software. Instead, Apple quietly announced on March 7 that the highly personalized Siri would not be coming as early as hoped. Amazon in February announced a new version of its Alexa voice assistant that is powered by AI.

U.S. and China are the only two countries at the cutting edge of intelligent humanoid robots. Eventually, they will revolutionize everything from manufacturing to mining, caring for the elderly and fighting wars.
